<math alttext="negative 7.5 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>7.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></math> 

In an experiment, students record horizontal and vertical positions of an object as functions of time. The students claim that the data show that the horizontal acceleration of the object is approximately zero and the vertical acceleration of the object has a nonzero value. Which of the following evidence statements best supports this claim?

choices.label: The horizontal position is constant, and the vertical position is changing.
The horizontal position is changing, and the vertical position is constant.
The horizontal position is changing at a constant rate, and the vertical position is changing at a nonconstant rate.
The horizontal and vertical positions are both changing at constant rates.
The horizontal and vertical positions are both changing at nonconstant rates.

content.answer: The horizontal position is changing at a constant rate, and the vertical position is changing at a nonconstant rate.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
